purpose: To provide feedback on the process of creating and implementing custom module translations.
text: set the channel description: To provide feedback on the process of creating and implementing custom module translations.

It appears the feature might have screwed up my fields in one of my modules(the account i had translations added to isn’t being used for a live site so it’s not urgent) just thought it was something to note
Hey John, can you send me a link to the affected module?
update to prevent future confusion - *this was not a good test of the translation feature, there was developer error here I don’t think it was an issue with the translation feature now.*
Question: If I were to submit an internationalized module to the marketplace - would it work yet? and would it only be available to people who have access to this beta?
All customers will see translations on everything except default content for now.

interesting, so even if someone doesn’t have the beta they’d be able to add it to their portal?

This is mostly hypothetical at the moment, but I figured my team is preparing modules to submit to marketplace (wont be submitting until after Inbound most likely) just thought it’d be cool to take advantage of multi-lingual
Exactly. We don’t surface the information on the marketplace yet, but they will be able to add the module to their portal and if the module has their language it will just work.
very cool and forward thinking of you guys
